articles.title: Northern Ireland drivers will no longer be required to carry 'green card' insurance to travel in Republic of Ireland - Belfast Telegraph
articles.description: Green Card insurance documents which have been required for Northern Ireland motorists post-Brexit to drive in the Republic will no longer be required, the European Commission has said.
articles.content:

articles.description: "Last week the number of cases rose by 10 per cent driven by increased mixing, travel gatherings and easing of social restrictions," WHO Regional Director for Europe Hans Kluge said.
articles.content:
